channel.title: Developers wanted
channel.description: hey im makin an attempt at a writing a runescape bot using python it will basically be scar without your mouse moving (yes it can be done) for now it isnt going to be scriptable. that will come later. basically i need persons skilled in java and/or python if your interested post here and ask for more details.

item.title: Developers wanted
item.dc:creator: @Janilabo Janilabo
item.description:
@Janilabo wrote:

[quote=“DEAD, post:6, topic:5396”]theres one front on which any bot will work, and thats at the memory reading level. the client has to store all its information in the memory, and from their it could be easily taken. You could also change certain values to emulate mouse clicks. This is where i think botting for RS is headed, theres a project for tibia caused Tibia Auto which already opperates by reading the memory. This way requires no messing with the client, hence its undetectable, and changing the mouse pos values and click values. Quite easy to say, but to find where the mem addresses are allocated it would take a huge ammount of work, time, and patience. Unfortunately, even though i have the nessecary knowledge, im not up to it, but if you want the best, undetectable bot, this is it. It works like Scar, clicks on things, but doesnt look for colors, it looks thru the memory.[/quote]Woah. What is the name of program? Sounds very cool tool. …And do you think you could link/upload it? Would love to test it out.

Ps. Sorry about offtopic. :o

Read full topic

item.title: Developers wanted
item.dc:creator: @RegeX RegeX
item.description:
@RegeX wrote:

[quote=“DEAD, post:6, topic:5396”]theres one front on which any bot will work, and thats at the memory reading level. the client has to store all its information in the memory, and from their it could be easily taken. You could also change certain values to emulate mouse clicks. This is where i think botting for RS is headed, theres a project for tibia caused Tibia Auto which already opperates by reading the memory. This way requires no messing with the client, hence its undetectable, and changing the mouse pos values and click values. Quite easy to say, but to find where the mem addresses are allocated it would take a huge ammount of work, time, and patience. Unfortunately, even though i have the nessecary knowledge, im not up to it, but if you want the best, undetectable bot, this is it. It works like Scar, clicks on things, but doesnt look for colors, it looks thru the memory.[/quote]Good luck reading stuff from the JVM memoryspace, it allocates memory like it’s retarded

Read full topic

item.title: Developers wanted
item.dc:creator: @_DEAD *DEAD*
item.description:
@_DEAD wrote:

theres one front on which any bot will work, and thats at the memory reading level. the client has to store all its information in the memory, and from their it could be easily taken. You could also change certain values to emulate mouse clicks. This is where i think botting for RS is headed, theres a project for tibia caused Tibia Auto which already opperates by reading the memory. This way requires no messing with the client, hence its undetectable, and changing the mouse pos values and click values. Quite easy to say, but to find where the mem addresses are allocated it would take a huge ammount of work, time, and patience. Unfortunately, even though i have the nessecary knowledge, im not up to it, but if you want the best, undetectable bot, this is it. It works like Scar, clicks on things, but doesnt look for colors, it looks thru the memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Developers wanted
item.dc:creator: @cheor cheor
item.description:
@cheor wrote:

it wont be less detectable then scar. the benefit will be the ability to run more then one bot without using a virtual machine wich is useful for anyone on a low end computer or who wants to run more then 3 bots a once

Read full topic
